block.p: Silvia Patricia Coxe, a private art dealer in Zurich, and Nicholas Warren Waltner, who heads the Zurich office of Salomon Brothers, the investment bank, were married last evening in New York. The Rev. Dennis Robb, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Vincent Ferrer.

The bride, 33, was until last November the director of the Latin American art department at Christie's in New York. She graduated from Barnard College. She is the daughter of Olga Naftali of Scarsdale, N.Y., and the late Juan Alberto Coxe, and the stepdaughter of Eduardo Naftali. The bride's mother and stepfather own an export company in Scarsdale.

The bride, 33, was until last November the director of the Latin American art department at Christie's in New York. She graduated from Barnard College. She is the daughter of Olga Naftali of Scarsdale, N.Y., and the late Juan Alberto Coxe, and the stepdaughter of Eduardo Naftali. The bride's mother and stepfather own an export company in Scarsdale.

The bridegroom, also 33, graduated from Wesleyan University and received an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago. He is the son of Grace and Frank Waltner of Bothell, Wash. The bridegroom's mother retired as an administrative nurse at Providence Hospital in Everett, Wash. His father, a retired general contractor, breeds and trains thoroughbred horses in Bothell.
